text: Darcy Roper (born 31 March 1998) is an Australian athlete specialising in the long jump. He won a bronze medal at the 2019 Summer Universiade. Earlier he won a bronze at the 2016 World U20 Championships and a Silver at the 2015 IAAF World youth Championships. His personal best in the event is 8.20 metres (+1.4 m/s) set at the ACT State Championships 2020. He has also lept a wind assisted 8.32 meters (+2.6m/s) in Perth 2019. ==International competitions== {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |2015 |World Youth Championships |Cali, Colombia |bgcolor=silver|2nd |Long jump |8.01 m |- |2016 |World U20 Championships |Bydgoszcz, Poland |bgcolor=cc9966|3rd |Long jump |7.88 m |- |rowspan=2|2019 |Universiade |Naples, Italy |bgcolor=cc9966|3rd |Long jump |7.90 m |- |World Championships |Doha, Qatar |15th (q) |Long jump |7.82 m |} == Best performances== {| class="wikitable sortable" !Year !Competition !Venue !Position !Event !Result |- |2015 |World Youth Championships |Cali, Colombia |bgcolor=silver|2nd |Long jump |8.01 m |- |2019 |ACT Championships |Canberra, Australia |bgcolor=gold|1st |Long jump |8.20 m (w) |- |2019 |Jandakot Airport Perth Track Classic |Perth, Australia |bgcolor=gold|1st |Long jump |8.32 m (w) |- |2019 |Queensland International Track Classic |Brisbane, Australia |bgcolor=gold|1st |Long jump |8.05 m |- |2019 |Résisprint International |La Chaux-de-Fonds, Switzerland |4th |Long jump |8.12 m |- |2019 |Athletissima |Lausanne, Switzerland |6th |Long jump |8.05 m |- |2020 |ACT Championships |Canberra, Australia |bgcolor=gold|1st |Long jump |8.20 m |} ==References== Category:1998 births Category:Living people Category:Australian male long jumpers Category:Universiade bronze medalists for Australia Category:Universiade medalists in athletics (track and field) Category:Medalists at the 2019 Summer Universiade
